page.title: 09MADLEY FESTIVAL
page.content: Founded in 1966, the festival has grown in status and esteem, as well as popularity. It is now rated throughout the West Midlands, as a major musical event, taking place in Madley Church. Many famous musicians have appeared, including The King's Singers, the London Symphony Orchestra Wind Ensemble, Orchestra Da Camera and the English String Orchestra. Since 1970 an Art Exhibition has been included. The Festival aims to provide performances by top class Artists at a price within reach of ordinary folk; The Festival receives support from the West Midlands Arts, the Vaughan Williams Trust, local councils and industrial and commercial concerns. To keep costs low as possible a great deal of work is carried out by volunteers.
